alert.note: Alert for Day (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 6:00PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast South Dakota, including the following county, Day. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, roads, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 652 PM CDT, emergency management reported snowmelt flooding continues in the warned area. Flooding of numerous county and township roads continues including 447th Avenue, south of Waubay. - The office of Day County Emergency Management asks travelers to exercise caution and obey posted road closure and detour signs. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Webster, Waubay, Bristol, Enemy Swim Housing, Roslyn, Pierpont, Andover, Grenville, Butler, Lily, Holmquist, Antelope Lake, Waubay Lake, Swan Lake, Minnewasta Lake, Rush Lake, Opitz Lake, Waubay Wildlife Rec Area, Bitter Lake and Blue Dog Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
